label: ABC8D3_aP26_2_i_i_8i_3i-001
title: Albite (NaAlSi$_{3}$O$_{8}$, $S6_{8}$) Structure
comments:
We used the 13K data from (Smith, 1986), however they present their data in space group $C\overline{1}$, which doubles the primitive unit cell compared to the standard space group $P\overline{1}$ \#2.  We used findsym to convert from the presented cell to the conventional cell.  This involved a rotation of the cell, {\em e.g.}, the original $c$ axis is the $a$ axis in our standard primitive cell. 
 Technically this is ``low'' albite.  In high albite the silicon and aluminum atoms are mixed over all four sites, as in \href{current_web_home_dir/AB8C4_mC52_12_i_gi3j_2j-001}{sandine ($S6_{7}$)}.  Indeed, under some conditions albite crystals are seen in the sandine structure (Winter, 1979).  See the albite entry in (Downs, 2003) for other experimental work.
